name: Amanda McKenna
text:
This place was incredible!!!! I have never been to a haunt like this. My buddy and I drove over two hours from TN tonight to go. It was like being in a video game, or movie, it was so interactive and phenomenal. I'll be bringing friends from Michigan next weekend! Doing the VIP next time as well, though the general was still a good, frightening time!!!

Edited to add that my friends and I went last night on 12/05 for their Christmas 1979 and it was even better than the first time. We did VIP and happened to be the only three going through and it was so much fun. The elves, Santa, the fuzzy green man with the yellow eyes (don't want to give too much away!!!), everything was perfect. Fuzzy green man was probably the most terrifying thing I have ever seen. I also face planted toward the exit because I tripped over my feet, but I didn't care - I could not stop laughing! 10/10 again, this haunt is awesome.

resp.text: Thanks so much for visiting! I’m so glad you’ve decided to come back and try the VIP experience. It’s definitely a fan favorite!

name: Kelsi Danielle
text:
***YOU MAY WANT TO READ THIS BEFORE YOU TRY THIS HAUNT***

First off, We had a good time not necessarily because of the haunt but because we spent time with our family and made the most of it,  we went on Halloween night,which i am sure was one of their more busy nights, but this in NO WAY excuses the experience we had otherwise!!! The haunt was good overall, needed more interactive scenes, more scares as well... there was lots of running, and people trying to slam through doors- so there is room for people to be injured- several scenes require crawling, bending, stooping and running- if any of that is not something you can do i would  reconsider this haunt- all in all  it wasn't like any other haunt we have been to. To counteract the wait they had movies to view, as well as pin ball machines, and a concession stand (which was not open) in the lobby, and a nice selection of music.

NOW- the nitty gritty.

We purchased VIP tickets, no where on the website does it give a description of what VIP includes- but from our experience we always get  VIP because we get the best of the haunt- shorter wait times, more scares, more hands on.  UNFORTUNATELY for us this was not the case- on the ticket it states 7:00 pm-11:00 pm no set time  to be there, no rules or regulations. We arrived at 8:45 pm- walked to the ticket desk and presented our tickets, and were told that  from that moment  we had a 4.5 hour wait, VIP offered no perks, there was no shorter wait, VIP just offered a more hands on experience during the haunt- plus you wear a nifty glow necklace. The clerk asked were we local, and stated that if we wanted to we could go home and wait until our time - we were not local - we had in fact drove 1 hour to this haunt-  we discussed this and decided we were just going to get a refund and go home. NOPE- there are no refunds. the clerk offered us to come back the next night or later on in the month-  but we were uninterested. We had no choice but to wait or lose 200.00.
We literally waited 4 hours and 50 minutes.  By the time we were called to participate we were worn out and sleepy. I say all of that to question why make people pay more for VIP with no true perks? We were not grabbed more, we were not interacted with more, there was no extra  questions asked nor were we involved in the haunt as we were told we would be -

Giving them 2 stars - we had a good time- but any bad situation is what you make it.

name: Courtney Lewis
text: If you want a haunted house worth your money I HIGHLY recommend this place!! I’m usually not scared easily but I didn’t even make it completely out of this one I WAS TOO SCARED LOL!! THE ACTORS ARE AMAZING, and super hands on unlike other haunted houses in the area. The wait time is a bit long, but soooo worth it. THIS IS THE BEST ONE I HAVE EVER BEEN TO.

name: JAMIE LAURA
text: I would ABSOLUTELY love to recommend this place as a great way to get your spook on! I went with a group from my own haunt , Nashville Nightmare, (drove 2 hours away for this)  and I must say as used to being scary and scaring people of our own, I think most of us enjoyed getting spooked ourselves. The story line , the actors , the staff , and all involved in this, AMAZING WORK. It all comes together nicely and the most horrific scare factor was truly there through the entire thing! It is a “Full Contact” haunt, but that makes it even more amazing. I wouldn’t recommend this attraction for anyone under , in my opinion , probably 15. The actors can grab you, run away with you , etc. But because of the craziness of the world with COVID , they took that into consideration and made it “safe” (lol) and mainly grab at your leg or arm. Anyway, I would DEFINITELY recommend this one! If you are like me and a LOVER of all things Spooky and Halloween , make this one one to visit for sure ! I will most definitely be back, this is one of my favorites by far!

name: Landon K
text:
My wife & I plan to go to 5 haunted houses in the Birmingham area.
We already went to 5 in Georgia/East AL.
The haunted houses we plan to go to in Birmingham are: Insanitarium, Hellbilly Hollow, Sloss Furnace, Atrox, Warehouse 31.
We are yet to visit Sloss Furnace, Atrox, or Warehouse 31.

So far our favorite haunted houses in order have been:
1) Netherworld
2) Nightmare's Gate
3) Paranoia
4) Hellbilly Hollow
5) Hollis Haunted Chicken House
6) Insanitarium
7) Folklore (only BAD haunt we have been to)

Friday Night October 6th we went to Insanitarium and Hellbilly Hollow.

This is my review on Hellbilly Hollow.

Hellbilly Hollow "Great Outdoor/Indoor Haunt"

There are three haunts to Hellbilly Hollow. Swamp ride(haunted hay ride), Haunted Corn Maze, Haunted House. All the employees were real nice and they had cotton candy and other vendors there for food etc. There were no monsters walking around so the scares didn't start until the first attraction. This Haunt most closely resembles Hollis Haunted Chicken House, but its better and cheaper. They also have really cool looking shirts that glow in blacklight and come in girl and guy colors. (I tried to edit the shirt though because I wont wear a shirt with what a consider to be a curse word on it).

Firstly, we did the swamp ride. Its a tractor pulling a trailer with wood benches...basically a hay ride with no hay. The monsters came out of the woods, ran around the trailer, jumped on the trailer, and did touch. It was very well done and if I hadn't been holding onto my wife there is no doubt she would have jumped off and went running into the woods.

Secondly, we did the corm maze. Its not a maze though, more like a trail cut out through the corn. There were several spots cut out for monsters to stand waiting to scare us. My wife tried to take off running several times and it was quite fun for me to watch. The best part of the corn maze was listening to the monsters yelling at each other about us as we walked through. It added a bit of comedy to the scares.

Thirdly, we did the Haunted House. Once we entered we got a little story and 2 ladies starting telling my wife how good she smelled and how she was going to look pretty with blood all over her. The haunt was well done and had obvious themes throughout. It weaved inside and outside as well. There were some cool effects used and again a lot of touching.

My wife commented afterwards that she has never been touched so much at a haunted house (which is not a bad thing). I can also say that she tried to run away more here than any other haunt. I can't say which of the three haunts were the best, but the combination of the three made for a very good experience. The combination of the three took about 45 minutes and we were there a total of an hour.

It didn't help with the storms that hit but the security staff seemed to freak out a little bit when the rain hit and the was no real plan for how to handle the crowd that was present. It also helps to let people on the website know that the forest is usually first then the the furnace.  The staff working both lines did great at handling things the best they could and giving information on when things would start back up. The furnace tour was decent it has been better.  The outbreak 2 was honestly pretty sad but I'm marking it up to the rain and the lack of interest sue to the rain. A couple years ago outbreak was great but honestly the money made from the haunted house doesn't seem to be put back into the nexts years set up. I hope it was just an off night because of the rain because if that is the best they had it is lacking.

After we asked the attendant taking tickets, she said that we would have to wait in line regardless. Bad management. When we finally went in the factory there were a handful of scare actors throughout the whole thing. I'm not sure if they are low on staff or didn't anticipate a high turnout, but they missed the mark by a mile. There were maybe 10-13 actors throughout the entire thing where in past years I swear they had 30+. There was one section that was filled with fog/smoke that had about .5-1" of water on the floor. Make sure to wear waterproof shoes or not care about have soaked feet afterwards 😡.

The 3D clown maze was pretty cool. The artwork was amazing! Though, after see so many actors in the other trails I was a bit disappointed that there were so few in this section.

Overall a great attraction. Has bathrooms if needed but bring your own tp and sanitizer.

The haunt was was fun/funny because of our group. It's not "scary scary" but it was fun. The actors were good. The costumes & makeup were good too. Don't act scared and they won't bother you...much lol

name: Amanda Moore
text: My daughters and I visited Doomsday on Halloween night.  With regards to the experience and scare factor, the attraction is money well spent.  Top notch actors and scenes, great location, and I definitely felt like we got our money's worth.  I especially appreciated the "Slasher" ticket option that allowed us to have a shorter wait time to get into the attraction.  My youngest daughter became very (visibly) scared early on into the walk.  (She thought she was ready for it but realized pretty quickly that she wasn't.)  What happened next, for me, is what sets this attraction apart from other similar attractions.  As soon as the actors became aware of how frightened she was, they made it a point to do everything that they could do to comfort/reassure her.  The crazy clown in the orange jumpsuit was great to us, leading us out at the end. The cemetery sisters were especially kind to her as was the young man playing the part of the butcher.  He was a large guy and his size alone was intimidating (as was his costume).  When he saw how upset she was, he approached her and told her that everything was going to be ok and that he would walk the remainder of the way with us!  He essentially stepped in as a bodyguard of sorts for us.  As we walked on through, all of the actors went out of their way to let her know that they weren't going to scare her.  Attention to detail with regards to scaring people is what attractions such as this are known for.  The attention to other details (such as comforting a frightened child) are a totally different skill set that the amazing actors at Doomsday bring to the table.  If these type of attractions are for you, then you definitely don't want to miss this one!

name: GoosieGurl101
text:
We had a blast!! Long lines, definitely worth it!! We waited for a bit for the opening ceremony, but it was amazing!!
Ardmore location was awesome, but Athens was knocked out of the park!! I asked about some of my favorite scenes. They explained the situation with the time frame they had to get it together for this year. As a long time supporter of Doomsday, I have to say I'm excited for next year. You guys are gonna kill it!!!

name: Descriptor
text:
This is a pretty fun haunted attraction not too far from town, and reasonably affordable, to boot! It's kinda of the haunted woods variety, and has all sorts of scares, including chainsaws, cannibalism, medical expenses, bubbles, and codependency! The actors all have a fun time with it, and are pretty good at ab-libbing, if you're of the snarkier persuasion. Would recommend heartily!

Expect maybe a 2-3 hour wait time, especially around Halloween.

name: RodneyWalls1
text:
Mark your calendars for a 5 star experience! 1 2 they’re coming for you! This is the place to vist for your Halloween festivities! Me and 2 other friends had a SPOOKTACULER experience. Upon entering we were greeted by friendly amazing staff while purchasing tickets. There was concessions on hand where you could order items and receive souvenir drinks as we entered the fun zone. As we waited in line entertaining music, fire, and experienced actors set the haunting mood as we anticipated entering the dark trail. Once we entered into the vast creepy darkness of woods you heard silence, but then, the sounds of screams and chainsaws broke though the eeriness of the woods. As we walked forward many scenes provided great jump scares. Abundant coffins, hearses and haunting structures was throughout the woods. The actors hid behind doors, around corners, and in the darkness waiting to jump-scare and were committed to staying in character and making creepy and scary voices. The creatures of nightmares unleashed their hunting rituals and you may find yourself in spine-tingling scare zones without warning! Enjoy the butcher shop, clowns, zombies, vampires and more. The bubble suds room was the icing on the cake. Endless entertainment brought us scares we were dying for around every corner. See what awaits your dreams, because the only nightmare would be missing the haunt. If you’re not to scared check them out. Were glad we did. It brought many scares and laughs well cherish for a lifetime.

Remember…You can’t by Halloween memories on a shelf. You have to go make them! And it’s the right time and place. They’ll leave a light on for ya!  BOOO!!

name: Grace Bell
text: Ok, so this was an awesome haunted house! It was thrilling to go through. They did a really awesome job decorating and the costumes. They actually scared me a couple of times. It was so much fun. Some of the staff wasn’t very nice/friendly... but I’m sure it was because they have to deal with stupid people that go through the house and don’t follow the rules like they’re suppose to. The only thing that killed it for me was, if you don’t spend the extra money to buy the fast pass... You’re gonna be waiting in line for 3+ hours, unless you get there super early to wait in the ticket line. But while you’re waiting in line, some of the characters wander around scaring the ba-Jesus out of the people. It’s quite entertaining.

name: Ray Freeman
text: Went yesterday on 10/19/2019. So when I arrived I saw a long line and jumped right in. Not realizing that it was NOT the ticket line because the sigh for admission is on the other side of the haunted house so if the people in line didn’t inform me the ticket line was on the other side I would have waited in line longer than I did. So I got back in line in waited about 2 hours maybe 3 hours... just to go in a clown house that only lasted about 3 Minutes. After the clown house I had to wait another 2 hours just to go in the main haunted house. We had to wait longer because they informed us they needed a break because they been working since 7:00pm Reminder (you have people in line that has been waiting just as long.) Went into the haunted house and it was amazing! Everything was awesome! I loved it. But hated the wait! Just a little advice..... 1.)Feed your staff before they start! That prevents longer wait  times.2.)  Please have at least a staff member directing people where to go to buy tickets it would have helped me a lot.  3.) Keep up the good work. If y’all get the wait time down by at least a hour I think it would be GREAT! I will be returning to see if reviews actually matter to you guys! Not trying to be smart just being honest! I understand the wait time warnings but at least try to make every effort to make the wait a little shorter than it was. FYI you have to pay first than wait the long wait. So your kinda force to stay. I don’t think they do refunds! But the haunted house is a 5 stars the wait was a 3 stars.

name: My Email
text: Offer more places to buy advance tickets. For the crowd you have you should make it easier for people to get in/out to enjoy it. Also the fact that you accept cash only for tickets on site should be told on website.

resp.text: In fact it is stated on the website. There's even a warning about extended waits on the busier nights, and how to avoid those by purchasing your cash only tickets in advance.

text: One of the coolest haunted houses I have ever been to. Very creative and something for everyone. Just when you think you are done something else is around the corner! We took our 12 year old and he absolutely loved it.

name: Becky Shepard
text: Actually no I did not love this place I gave 5 stars because it is called a "haunted house." Never in a million years will I ever consider taking my child to a true haunted house even at Halloween. I just drove by and got out walked around and looked with a friend; it was closed at the time. I felt some of the most serious abnormal fear and well, I  cannot even think of  perfect Florida. Although, I treated it with utmost respect.  It really  affected me afterwards. Therefore I deleted all photos and videos except for this one I have.  If in fact I do ever come a cross the videos / pictures I will share.  Never again...

Needless to say we spent the money and didn't even go into the main house. So caution for children that may not handle being scared or may be clostraphobic.

They looked like a train behind each other one holding the other from behind putting my oldest in front the three other nice young ladies then my 14 year old and My husband I. I think we had more fun watching them, and how each one of them stepped all at the same time with each foot. It was fun. the wait is what is so horrible. They need benches or something for the line for us older people. But this year it was longer than usual and they added on. It was fun. Not as scary as I thought would be. But was a nice family time with our girls.
